intro: Thujopsis borealis, commonly known as the northern incense-cedar, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Cupressaceae family, which includes cypresses and junipers. The plant has scale-like leaves that are closely arranged along the branches, giving it a dense appearance. Its cones are small and woody, typically containing two to three seeds. Thujopsis borealis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in boreal forests and mountainous areas.
